Holy s***! The best story/puzzle (and possibly the only) game I have played in my life and overall, is one of the best games I've played so far. The storyline is far better than expected, and havent yet played the first portal game. The game progressively gets harder and harder (especially old Aperture) and is quite a challenge. I was quite stumped on most parts of the death chamber, but managed to self destruct it in just the nick of time. The co-op is quite a challenge, but with the two brains working together, it all works out, but the singleplayer definitely has more storyline into it. Despite reverse order, I am playing Portal only because of this game. Portal 2, overall, is the 2nd best game I've ever owned. We definitely need a Portal 3, and when/if it comes out, I'm buying it on release, or maybe even pre-order it. Along with the Portal series, I will definitely look into buying more games from Valve, such as the Half-Life series.

Esse jogo é incrível porque ele te chama de burro, de gordo e de outras ofensas descoladas e mesmo assim vc volta pra passar mais 30 minutos naquela fase que esta empacado tendo ataques de raiva e frustração, prometendo pra si mesmo que nao vai procurar no youtube como que resolve, até q por sorte aleatóriedade do destino ou só inspiração magica, vc soluciona o quebra-cabeça com algo q era tão obvio que só resta admitir que o jogo estava certo, vc é realmente burro.
GLaDOS go talk talk

Oh my god. Words cant describe this masterpeice.

I have a potato pc, but this game runs 1080p at 60fps. People Playground (lower quality game) somehow runs worse than this beauty. The graphics are wonderful for the requirements not needing to be so high.

The story, characters, and the character development is legendary. Valve really puts hard work into their games, and boy does it pay off to them.

I haven't played much of the co-op, had a few issues with the audio and microphone things. I think it was the friend I was playing with but ya can't always be sure. The co op is very wonderful.

The price tag is worth it, heck I'd pay 20$ for this.

The community workshop support and mods like Aperture Tag are nice. (i don't own it but i seen let's-plays on youtube)

And to wrap this review up, yes you should buy it.

Oh and, valve where the flip is Portal 3???

edit: Portal 3 potentially is the Lego Dimensions version with Chell coming back to Aperture. I don't know much of the LD Portal story, but it looks like lego made their own portal with valve's permission. Valve for the love of god please make a portal 3!!!!
